TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit DataSetFieldSchema extends System.Object implements class System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema

Docs.summary: Represents the structure, or schema, of a data field.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema> class to get the properties of a data field using a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn>. You can discover the structure of a data field by using the following properties in this class: <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.DataType%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.IsReadOnly%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.Length%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.Name%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.IsUnique%2A>. In addition, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.Identity%2A> property to determine if a data column is set for <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.AutoIncrement%2A>, or the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.PrimaryKey%2A> property to determine if a data column is in the primary key.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema> class is used by custom control designer components to provide information about a data field at design time.
To examine the components of data using a <xref:System.Data.DataSet>, use the following classes.
- <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetSchema>
- <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetViewSchema>
- <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema>

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Data.DataColumn column) cil managed

Docs.param: A object that the object describes.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using a specified .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema> class to examine the properties of a data field using a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> object.

Docs.summary: Gets the type of data stored in the data field.
Docs.value: A object that represents the type of data the data field contains.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the value of the data field automatically increments for each new row added to the table or view.
Docs.value: if the is numeric and the value of the column increments automatically as new rows are added to the ; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.Identity%2A> property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.AutoIncrement%2A> property of a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn>.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the is read-only.
Docs.value: if the data field is read-only; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether values in the data field are required to be unique.
Docs.value: if data in the data field is unique; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.IsUnique%2A> property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.Unique%2A> property of a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn>.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating the size of data that can be stored in the data field.
Docs.value: The number of bytes the column can store.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.Length%2A> property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.MaxLength%2A> property of a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn>.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the data field.
Docs.value: The name of the data field.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.Name%2A> property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.ColumnName%2A> property of a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn>.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the data field can accept values.
Docs.value: if the data field can accept values; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.Nullable%2A> property corresponds to the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.AllowDBNull%2A> property of a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn>.

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum number of digits used to represent a numerical value in the data field.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.Precision%2A> property is required by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema> interface, but is not used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema> class.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the data field is in the primary key for the containing table or view.
Docs.value: if the data field is in the primary key; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets the number of decimal places to which numerical values in the data field are resolved.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema.Scale%2A> property is required by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceFieldSchema> interface, but is not used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetFieldSchema> class.
